definitions.definition: A legal scholar of the Middle Ages , ( specifically ) one who authored glosses on legal texts (especially the Corpus Juris of Justinian), typically distinguished from the later commentators who wrote in extended prose and adopted a more pragmatic form of jurisprudence .

secondary_definitions: ( historical , law ) A legal scholar of the Middle Ages , ( specifically ) one who authored glosses on legal texts (especially the Corpus Juris of Justinian), typically distinguished from the later commentators who wrote in extended prose and adopted a more pragmatic form of jurisprudence .
